Gene Kogan

  • Works
  • About

KinectProjectorToolkit is a Processing library which enables the calibration of a Kinect depth camera and a projector, so that the projected image is automatically mapped to the physical space it is projecting onto. Some applications of the toolkit are summarized in this demo video, taken during a 2-day workshop applying the software to live, improvisational dance.

The toolkit is open source, and is freely available on GitHub. Along with the core software, the toolkit comes with a setup application for easily generating the calibrtion, a performance application for applying effects onto calibrated stages, and a number of simple code examples demonstrating basic projection techniques.

Along with the instructions on the GitHub page, a full tutorial video explaining the calibration process is also available on Vimeo:

KinectProjectorToolkit is an ongoing project and more performances using the software are scheduled for 2014, in addition to a long list of development goals. Many thanks to all the people that have helped bring the project to where it is today, including Le Thanh Theatre in Saigon and Erarta Museum in St. Petersburg for providing spaces for research and development, to Antonio Rosciano and ZeroStation for producing timely workshops, and to Jan Hrdliƒçka, Daito Manabe, Elliot Woods, Kyle McDonald, and Christian Parsons for their previous work in the area, providing signifcant precursors to this toolkit.
